condition.description:
Your digestive or gastrointestinal (GI) tract includes the esophagus, stomach, small intestine, large intestine or colon, rectum, and anus. Bleeding can come from any of these areas. The amount of bleeding can be so small that only a lab test can find it.

Signs of bleeding in the digestive tract depend where it is and how much bleeding there is.

Signs of bleeding in the upper digestive tract include

  • Bright red blood in vomit
  • Vomit that looks like coffee grounds
  • Black or tarry stool
  • Dark blood mixed with stool

Signs of bleeding in the lower digestive tract include

  • Black or tarry stool
  • Dark blood mixed with stool
  • Stool mixed or coated with bright red blood

GI bleeding is not a disease, but a symptom of a disease. There are many possible causes of GI bleeding, including hemorrhoids, peptic ulcers, tears or inflammation in the esophagus, diverticulosis and diverticulitis, ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease, colonic polyps, or cancer in the colon, stomach or esophagus.

The test used most often to look for the cause of GI bleeding is called endoscopy. It uses a flexible instrument inserted through the mouth or rectum to view the inside of the GI tract. A type of endoscopy called colonoscopy looks at the large intestine.

NIH: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases
condition.name: Gastrointestinal bleeding

carousel_items: Epinephrine comes in an adult dose and child dose autoinjector. Know how to use the injector before you need it by practicing with the sample injector in the Epinephrine kit.

When needed, inject the entire amount of medicine into the upper, outer part of the thigh, through clothing if necessary. If the severe allergic reaction doesn’t go away, the dose can be repeated with a second Epinephrine in 5 to 15 minutes.
It's best to get medical attention immediately, even though you gave the injection.
In overweight or obese people, including children, inject Epinephrine into the lower half of the thigh or calf.
Epinephrine is sensitive to light and air and will turn pink or brown if it goes bad. Don’t inject the solution if it’s discolored or contains solid particles.
Any additional doses will need to be given by a doctor in a healthcare setting.

basics.benefits_moa: Epinephrine is like adrenaline. It relaxes muscles in your lungs and relieves spasm, wheezing, and shortness of breath that happens during a severe allergic reaction (anaphylaxis).
basics.bottom_line: Epinephrine is a life-saving medication for severe allergic reactions. Just make sure you know how to give an injection before it's needed.
downsides: If you have heart disease or high blood pressure, you may a greater risk of having side effects from Epinephrine.
You can only use 2 Epinephrine injections to treat a severe allergic reaction. If you need a 3rd dose, it'll have to be given by a doctor in a hospital or healthcare setting.
Injecting Epinephrine into body parts other than the upper/outer thigh can cause serious damage and may not treat your allergic reaction. Never, ever accidentally inject it into your hand.
You should keep two Epinephrine injectors that haven't expired yet with you at all times if you know you have severe allergies to insects, foods, drugs, or other products.

downsides_processed.orig: If you have heart disease or high blood pressure, you may a greater risk of having side effects from Epinephrine.
You can only use 2 Epinephrine injections to treat a severe allergic reaction. If you need a 3rd dose, it'll have to be given by a doctor in a hospital or healthcare setting.
Injecting Epinephrine into body parts other than the upper/outer thigh can cause serious damage and may not treat your allergic reaction. Never, ever accidentally inject it into your hand.
You should keep two Epinephrine injectors that haven't expired yet with you at all times if you know you have severe allergies to insects, foods, drugs, or other products.

upsides: Epinephrine is an easy-to-use automatic injector. Just place the injector on the upper/outer part of your thigh and press a button.
Can be used immediately to stop a life-threatening allergic reaction.
The Jr. dose is for children 33lbs to 66 lbs. Adults should use the standard Epinephrine.

upsides_processed.orig: Epinephrine is an easy-to-use automatic injector. Just place the injector on the upper/outer part of your thigh and press a button.

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: An injection of epinephrine can cause a significant increase in blood pressure.

description_processed.orig: An injection of epinephrine can cause a significant increase in blood pressure.

risks_warnings.title: Emergency treatment
risks_warnings.description: Injecting Epinephrine is only part of the treatment for a severe allergic reaction. In addition to the one or two injections given by yourself or a family member, you'll need to get immediate medical attention.

description_processed.orig: Injecting Epinephrine is only part of the treatment for a severe allergic reaction. In addition to the one or two injections given by yourself or a family member, you'll need to get immediate medical attention.

risks_warnings.title: Wrong area of injection
risks_warnings.description: Epinephrine can only be injected into the upper/outer part of the thigh, or for obese individuals, the lower part of thigh or calf. Injecting Epinephrine in other areas of the body can cause serious injury and won't completely treat your allergic reaction.

description_processed.orig: Epinephrine can only be injected into the upper/outer part of the thigh, or for obese individuals, the lower part of thigh or calf. Injecting Epinephrine in other areas of the body can cause serious injury and won't completely treat your allergic reaction.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening heart problems or high blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: If you have heart disease or high blood pressure, you can have more side effects if you use Epinephrine. It can cause temporary worsening of chest pain and palpitations.

description_processed.orig: If you have heart disease or high blood pressure, you can have more side effects if you use Epinephrine. It can cause temporary worsening of chest pain and palpitations.

carousel_items: Take 1 hour before a meal.
Don't chew or crush capsules; swallow them whole.
If you have trouble swallowing you can carefully open the capsules and sprinkle the inside pellets onto applesauce. Swallow the applesauce without chewing or crushing the pellets.

When using Omeprazole long-term, take a calcium citrate with vitamin D supplement daily to prevent bone loss. Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.
Get a blood test for your magnesium level once a year; you may need a magnesium supplement while using Omeprazole.
Avoid drug interactions by telling your doctor all of the other medications or herbal supplements you take before starting Omeprazole.

clock.tip: Take on an empty stomach before breakfast.

basics.benefits_moa: Omeprazole is a proton pump inhibitor (PPI). It lowers the amount of acid in your stomach, treats heartburn, and heals ulcers.
basics.bottom_line: Omeprazole gives you long-lasting heartburn relief. Choose the cheapest proton pump inhibitor because they all work equally well for heartburn.
downsides: Doesn't start working as fast as some other antacids like Tums, Rolaids, or Maalox.
Like with other proton pump inhibitors, long-term use can cause weak or broken bones.
Can cause low levels of magnesium in the blood. You might need to take a magnesium supplement if you use Omeprazole long-term.
Although the generic is affordable, other medications might still be cheaper than Omeprazole.
Can interact with other drugs so be sure your doctor knows all the medicine you're taking before starting Omeprazole.

downsides_processed.orig: Doesn't start working as fast as some other antacids like Tums, Rolaids, or Maalox.
Like with other proton pump inhibitors, long-term use can cause weak or broken bones.
Can cause low levels of magnesium in the blood. You might need to take a magnesium supplement if you use Omeprazole long-term.
Although the generic is affordable, other medications might still be cheaper than Omeprazole.
Can interact with other drugs so be sure your doctor knows all the medicine you're taking before starting Omeprazole.

upsides: Most people can take Omeprazole without any noticeable day-to-day side effects.
Omeprazole lasts longer than other types of antacids (like Zantac, Pepcid, or Tums), and you only need to take it once or twice a day.
You can take it in combination with a quick-acting antacid (like Maalox or Tums) if you need relief right away.
In studies it was better than a placebo (sugar pill) and as good as other proton pump inhibitors at treating heartburn.
Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.

userStories.identifier: Golf twice a wk, not good but ok for 87.
userStories.tip: Took Nexium for seven years, then found Omerprazole. Worked so well for two years that I cut the caplets in half two years ago. All's well so far. Have forgotten a few times but remember real quick, within two hours, discomfort.
Take in the morning when you get up.

The generics don't work as well as name-brand Prilosec, but it could just be placebo effect. I could get it much cheaper from the pharmacy for awhile (until my prescription plan stopped covering it) so ask your doctor if that's an option.

userStories.identifier: Parent, average weight and activity leve
userStories.tip: Take it at the same time every day.

I was having horrible acid reflux and was diagnosed with Barrett's rings in my esophagus 9 years ago. Since I started taking this simple drug, the acid reflux is completely gone and the ring growth has been arrested.

Skipping a dose or two does not seem to cause problems.   Occasional break-through heartburn easily fixed with Tums.  Even with a large copay it is cheaper if you get a prescription and have it filled at the pharmacy.
Take 40 mg case I have Barrett and risk of oesaphageal cancer good product better ones out there but does the job

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: This pill gave me an uncertain feeling in my stomach, and my heart burn didn't really go although it did reduce. Stopped taking them in favour of ranitidine and gaviscon.

I take 10mg every morning at least an hour before I eat something. As long as I follow this rule every day, I never have heartburn. If I don't, I will get heartburn regularly over even the most mildest foods.
Take in the morning before eating ... huge help.
Taking it every day 30mins before breakfast results in no heartburn at all. But i´m concerned about long term side effects like problems in B12 inhibit, calcium, colesterol

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take 1 hour before a meal.
Don't chew or crush capsules; swallow them whole.
If you have trouble swallowing you can carefully open the capsules and sprinkle the inside pellets onto applesauce. Swallow the applesauce without chewing or crushing the pellets.

When using Omeprazole long-term, take a calcium citrate with vitamin D supplement daily to prevent bone loss. Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.
Get a blood test for your magnesium level once a year; you may need a magnesium supplement while using Omeprazole.
Avoid drug interactions by telling your doctor all of the other medications or herbal supplements you take before starting Omeprazole.

risks_warnings.title: Hiding possible cancer
risks_warnings.description: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Omeprazole for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

description_processed.orig: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Omeprazole for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis)
risks_warnings.description: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis) has occasionally happened to people taking Omeprazole.  It can lead to digestion trouble, low vitamin B12 levels, and anemia. It's more common if you have a stomach infection caused by the bacteria Helicobacter pylori. If you need to take Omeprazole for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

description_processed.orig: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis) has occasionally happened to people taking Omeprazole.  It can lead to digestion trouble, low vitamin B12 levels, and anemia. It's more common if you have a stomach infection caused by the bacteria Helicobacter pylori. If you need to take Omeprazole for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Severe diarrhea
risks_warnings.description: Using medications like Omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) can increase the chance of getting severe diarrhea.  This diarrhea is caused by an infection from a bacteria called clostridium difficle or C.Diff.  The infection is difficult to treat and can be life threatening. You are at a higher risk for C.Diff if you are currently or have recently been in a hospital.  You are also at higher risk if you are currently or have recently taken any antibiotic medication. If you develop significant diarrhea while taking Omeprazole or after stopping it, let you doctor know right away.

description_processed.orig: Using medications like Omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) can increase the chance of getting severe diarrhea.  This diarrhea is caused by an infection from a bacteria called clostridium difficle or C.Diff.  The infection is difficult to treat and can be life threatening. You are at a higher risk for C.Diff if you are currently or have recently been in a hospital.  You are also at higher risk if you are currently or have recently taken any antibiotic medication. If you develop significant diarrhea while taking Omeprazole or after stopping it, let you doctor know right away.

risks_warnings.title: Broken bones
risks_warnings.description: There is an increased risk of developing weakened bones (osteoporosis) and broken bones (fractures) while taking medications like Omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors).  It is believed that this happens because your stomach doesn't absorb calcium well while using this medication. Calcium is necessary for strong, healthy bones. In studies, people were more likely to get broken bones while using proton pump inhibitors when taking high doses and using them long-term (1 year or more). You are also at higher risk if you smoke or have other risk factors for osteoporosis.  The best way to prevent this side effect is to use the lowest dose of medication for the shortest period of time.  Taking a calcium supplement may or may not help prevent broken bones while using Omeprazole.  However, if you need to take Omeprazole long-term you should take a calcium supplement to be safe.  Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.
risk_factors: Use of other medications that weaken bones

description_processed.orig: There is an increased risk of developing weakened bones (osteoporosis) and broken bones (fractures) while taking medications like Omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors).  It is believed that this happens because your stomach doesn't absorb calcium well while using this medication. Calcium is necessary for strong, healthy bones. In studies, people were more likely to get broken bones while using proton pump inhibitors when taking high doses and using them long-term (1 year or more). You are also at higher risk if you smoke or have other risk factors for osteoporosis.  The best way to prevent this side effect is to use the lowest dose of medication for the shortest period of time.  Taking a calcium supplement may or may not help prevent broken bones while using Omeprazole.  However, if you need to take Omeprazole long-term you should take a calcium supplement to be safe.  Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.

risks_warnings.title: Low vitamin or mineral levels
risks_warnings.description: All proton pump inhibitor medications, including Omeprazole, can cause low levels of blood magnesium or vitamin B12. This can happen with as little as 3 months of use but more commonly occurs after you've been using Omeprazole for a year or more. Your doctor can do a blood test to see if you need to take a vitamin or mineral supplement.

Your doctor can do a blood test to see if you need to take a vitamin or mineral supplement.

carousel_items: Short-term treatment of ulcers and acid reflux.

basics.benefits_moa: Famotidine is a type of antacid called an H2 blocker. It blocks the chemical histamine, which lowers acid production in your stomach. This treats heartburn and helps ulcers heal.
basics.bottom_line: Famotidine works well for heartburn but may not last as long or start working as quickly as other antacids.
downsides: Other antacids like Maalox, Tums, or Rolaids often start to work more quickly than Famotidine.
Medication like omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) works better at healing and preventing stomach ulcers than medication like Famotidine (H2 blockers).
Can cause more serious side effects for people with kidney disease. Ask your doctor to give you a lower dose or choose a different option.

downsides_processed.orig: Other antacids like Maalox, Tums, or Rolaids often start to work more quickly than Famotidine.
Medication like omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) works better at healing and preventing stomach ulcers than medication like Famotidine (H2 blockers).
Can cause more serious side effects for people with kidney disease. Ask your doctor to give you a lower dose or choose a different option.

upsides: Most people can take Famotidine without any noticeable day-to-day side effects.
Famotidine lasts longer than many other antacids like Maalox and Tums, and you only need to take it once or twice a day.
You can take it in combination with a quick-acting antacid (like Maalox or Tums) if you need relief right away.
Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.
Few drug interactions.

risks_warnings.title: Hiding possible cancer

description_processed.orig: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Famotidine for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: Because Famotidine is processed by the kidney it can cause some worrisome side effects for people with kidney problems. These include confusion, delirium, and a dangerous irregular heartbeat known as QT prolongation.   If you have kidney problems, you may need a different dose to prevent this increased risk for side effects.

description_processed.orig: Because Famotidine is processed by the kidney it can cause some worrisome side effects for people with kidney problems. These include confusion, delirium, and a dangerous irregular heartbeat known as QT prolongation.   If you have kidney problems, you may need a different dose to prevent this increased risk for side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: Famotidine can cause an allergic reaction.  The reaction might cause swelling of the throat, face, lips or tongue, difficulty breathing, or rash. If this happens to you stop taking Famotidine and get medical help right away. Do not take Famotidine if you have ever had an allergic reaction to similar medications like zantac or tagamet.

If this happens to you stop taking Famotidine and get medical help right away. Do not take Famotidine if you have ever had an allergic reaction to similar medications like zantac or tagamet.

carousel_items: Can cause headaches, dizziness, lightheadedness, or fainting.
Don't drink alcohol while taking this medicine. It can make you really dizzy.
Tell your doctor if you're taking any medicine for erectile dysfunction.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

basics.benefits_moa: Isosorbide dinitrate is a nitrate. It dilates blood vessels all over the body. This makes it less work for the heart to pump, which relieves heart-related chest pain.
basics.bottom_line: Isosorbide dinitrate is good for chest pain, but you have to be able to stick to your dosing schedule or it won't work as well.
downsides: You can develop tolerance to this medicine over time, which means that the same dose becomes less effective. You have to stick to a really specific dosing schedule to prevent this from happening.
Headaches are normal with this medicine and they go away as your body gets used to it, but they can be severe or not tolerable for some people.

downsides_processed.orig: You can develop tolerance to this medicine over time, which means that the same dose becomes less effective. You have to stick to a really specific dosing schedule to prevent this from happening.
Headaches are normal with this medicine and they go away as your body gets used to it, but they can be severe or not tolerable for some people.

upsides: Treats and prevents heart-related chest pain (angina) from the narrowing of heart blood vessels (coronary artery disease).

upsides_processed.orig: Treats and prevents heart-related chest pain (angina) from the narrowing of heart blood vessels (coronary artery disease).

drugs.name: Isordil

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause headaches, dizziness, lightheadedness, or fainting.
Don't drink alcohol while taking this medicine. It can make you really dizzy.
Tell your doctor if you're taking any medicine for erectile dysfunction.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Dizziness and falls may occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, like from lying down or sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms continues for more than a week, talk to your doctor. Also tell your doctor if you are taking any drugs for erectile dysfunction, as this can increase the likelihood of dizziness or falls. Drinking alcohol while on this medication may also increase the risk of dizziness or falling.

description_processed.orig: Dizziness and falls may occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, like from lying down or sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms continues for more than a week, talk to your doctor. Also tell your doctor if you are taking any drugs for erectile dysfunction, as this can increase the likelihood of dizziness or falls. Drinking alcohol while on this medication may also increase the risk of dizziness or falling.

risks_warnings.title: Tolerance
risks_warnings.description: Your body can get used to Isosorbide dinitrate and the same amount of medicine no longer works as well as it used to, also known as tolerance. Tolerance can be avoided by having enough time in between taking the medicine. Tolerance cannot be fixed by increasing the amount of the medicine. Make sure there is enough time in between the doses. Your doctor or pharmacist will work with you to stop this from happening.

description_processed.orig: Your body can get used to Isosorbide dinitrate and the same amount of medicine no longer works as well as it used to, also known as tolerance. Tolerance can be avoided by having enough time in between taking the medicine. Tolerance cannot be fixed by increasing the amount of the medicine. Make sure there is enough time in between the doses. Your doctor or pharmacist will work with you to stop this from happening.

carousel_items: Can cause headaches, dizziness, lightheadedness, or fainting. Sit down before taking this medicine in case you get dizzy.
Take it exactly as instructed by your doctor.
Usually relieves chest pain in 1 to 5 minutes. If pain continues, you can take up to 3 doses, with 5 minutes in between each dose. Call 911 or go to the hospital if you've taken a second dose.
Don't drink alcohol while taking this medicine. It can make dizziness worse.
Tell your doctor if you're taking any medicine for erectile dysfunction.

basics.benefits_moa: Nitroglycerin is a nitrate. It dilates blood vessels all over the body. This makes it less work for the heart to pump, which relieves heart-related chest pain.
basics.bottom_line: Nitroglycerin is the fastest-working medicine to relieve chest pain, but make sure to sit down before taking it.
downsides: You can develop tolerance to this medicine over time, which means that the same dose becomes less effective. You have to stick to a really specific dosing schedule for the extended-release, ointment, and patch forms to prevent this from happening.
Headaches are normal with this medicine and they go away as your body gets used to it, but they can be severe or not tolerable for some people.

downsides_processed.orig: You can develop tolerance to this medicine over time, which means that the same dose becomes less effective. You have to stick to a really specific dosing schedule for the extended-release, ointment, and patch forms to prevent this from happening.
Headaches are normal with this medicine and they go away as your body gets used to it, but they can be severe or not tolerable for some people.

upsides: First-choice treatment for quick relief of heart-related chest pain (angina).
Can also be used to prevent chest pain from happening.

Available in various forms that take effect at different speeds and stay in your system for different lengths of time. Sublingual form works the fastest (1-3 minutes) but lasts the shortest in your body (25 minutes), while the patch form takes the longest to start working (30 minutes) but lasts the longest (10-12 hours). Your doctor can help you find the one that's best for you.

upsides_processed.orig: First-choice treatment for quick relief of heart-related chest pain (angina).
Can also be used to prevent chest pain from happening.

Your doctor can help you find the one that's best for you.

drugs.name: Nitrostat

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause headaches, dizziness, lightheadedness, or fainting. Sit down before taking this medicine in case you get dizzy.
Take it exactly as instructed by your doctor.
Usually relieves chest pain in 1 to 5 minutes. If pain continues, you can take up to 3 doses, with 5 minutes in between each dose. Call 911 or go to the hospital if you've taken a second dose.
Don't drink alcohol while taking this medicine. It can make dizziness worse.
Tell your doctor if you're taking any medicine for erectile dysfunction.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Nitroglycerin should not be used with an erectile dysfunction medicine without talking to your doctor. Dizziness or fainting may occur when taking Nitroglycerin when you change positions, such as going from a seated or lying down position to standing because of changes in your blood pressure, which may lead to falls. This is called orthostatic hypotension. Be very careful when changing positions, especially if you're just starting to take Nitroglycerin or if changes in dosing have to be made. Talk to your doctor if you have persistent dizziness or rapid heart rate for more than 1 week.
risk_factors: Concurrent use of erectile dysfunction medicine

description_processed.orig: Nitroglycerin should not be used with an erectile dysfunction medicine without talking to your doctor. Dizziness or fainting may occur when taking Nitroglycerin when you change positions, such as going from a seated or lying down position to standing because of changes in your blood pressure, which may lead to falls. This is called orthostatic hypotension. Be very careful when changing positions, especially if you're just starting to take Nitroglycerin or if changes in dosing have to be made. Talk to your doctor if you have persistent dizziness or rapid heart rate for more than 1 week.

risks_warnings.title: Tolerance
risks_warnings.description: Your body can get used to Nitroglycerin and the same amount of medicine no longer works as well as it used to, also known as tolerance. This type of tolerance cannot be fixed by increasing the amount of the medicine. The likelihood of tolerance can be lowered if there is enough time in between the doses. Take this medicine as instructed.

description_processed.orig: Your body can get used to Nitroglycerin and the same amount of medicine no longer works as well as it used to, also known as tolerance. This type of tolerance cannot be fixed by increasing the amount of the medicine. The likelihood of tolerance can be lowered if there is enough time in between the doses. Take this medicine as instructed.

basics.benefits_moa: Propranolol is an alpha and beta blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing heart rate, relaxing blood vessels, and lowering the body's fight-or-flight response.
basics.bottom_line: Propranolol is good for treating many heart problems and other problems in the body, but it has more side effects than other beta blockers. You can't miss doses.
downsides: Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.
Has more side effects than some beta blockers because it crosses into the brain and central nervous system.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Propranolol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.
Has more side effects than some beta blockers because it crosses into the brain and central nervous system.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Propranolol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

upsides: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina).
A first-choice treatment for heart failure, heart attack, heart valve disorders, and abnormal heart rhythm.
Also treats and prevents many non-heart problems, such as tremors, anxiety, migraines, and liver disease symptoms.

A first-choice treatment for heart failure, heart attack, heart valve disorders, and abnormal heart rhythm.
Also treats and prevents many non-heart problems, such as tremors, anxiety, migraines, and liver disease symptoms.

drugs.one_liner: Lowers blood pressure and controls heart rate.

userStories.tip: Nausea, dizziness and loss of energy.
I actually take it for essential tremor. It works very well. My hands no longer shake which is great.
The worst side effects for me...threw me into a deep depression. Horrendous.
I take it for occasional stage fright.

I've used it for public speaking, it works great totally stops irrriating hand or voice shakes. However; I experienced sudden dizziness after getting up quickly after a period of long period of sitting.
took this to manage shakes from lithium. it worked pretty well.

no issue; take as low of a dose as possible, remember to not skip doses, and prepare for a day when you don't need to take it any longer. completely stopped my anxiety from lasting more than a couple of minutes.
I started taking it for migraine prevention, but then found it completely rid me of my stage fright and issues with public speaking.
I'm taking very short amounts for anxiety since my doctor wants me to calm down but doesn't want to give me any drug that would mess up with my brain. It's working great!
Take it only when you need. It reduces the physical symptoms of anxiety, such as sweating, but it does not help with the mental aspect of anxiety

drugs.name: Propranolol

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Can cause insomnia and fatigue.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar. Be careful if you're diabetic.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

risks_warnings.title: Increased chest pain or risk of heart attack
risks_warnings.description: Do not stop taking Propranolol suddenly without talking to your doctor as chest pain or angina may become increased. Stopping Propranolol suddenly may start a heart attack. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

description_processed.orig: Do not stop taking Propranolol suddenly without talking to your doctor as chest pain or angina may become increased. Stopping Propranolol suddenly may start a heart attack. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Heart failure
risks_warnings.description: Cases of heart failure due to taking Propranolol have been reported. Tell your doctor if you noticed increased swelling around your legs or ankles, sudden weight gain or sudden shortness of breath as these may be symptoms of heart failure.

description_processed.orig: Cases of heart failure due to taking Propranolol have been reported. Tell your doctor if you noticed increased swelling around your legs or ankles, sudden weight gain or sudden shortness of breath as these may be symptoms of heart failure.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risks during surgery
risks_warnings.description: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Propranolol, so that they can monitor your heart more closely.

description_processed.orig: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Propranolol, so that they can monitor your heart more closely.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of low blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Propranolol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Propranolol.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Propranolol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Propranolol.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of overactive thyroid
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Propranolol who also have an overactive thyroid may not recognize signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Also, do not stop taking Propranolol suddenly without consulting your doctor, as this may start a thyroid storm.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Propranolol who also have an overactive thyroid may not recognize signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Also, do not stop taking Propranolol suddenly without consulting your doctor, as this may start a thyroid storm.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: You may notice a slowing of your heart rate when you take this medication. You may experience dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls. Also tell your doctor if your heart rate goes below 55 beats per minute as they may consider changing your dose. Your doctor may monitor your heart rate and rhythm.
risk_factors: Concurrent use of non-dihydropyridine calcium channel blockers, digoxin or clonidine

description_processed.orig: You may notice a slowing of your heart rate when you take this medication. You may experience dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls. Also tell your doctor if your heart rate goes below 55 beats per minute as they may consider changing your dose. Your doctor may monitor your heart rate and rhythm.

risks_warnings.title: Serious skin reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rare reports of skin rash have been reported which may be considered serious to life-threatening. If you notice a sudden severe skin rash with a fever, call your doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rare reports of skin rash have been reported which may be considered serious to life-threatening. If you notice a sudden severe skin rash with a fever, call your doctor immediately.
